summary: The "Supporting Premature Infant Nutrition Act of 2025" mandates no-cost coverage for human milk fortifier under Medicaid, the Children's Health Insurance Plan (CHIP), and group health plans/insurance. It defines "human milk fortifier" as a donor human milk product for infants under one year old meeting specific medical criteria (gestational age, birth weight, or congenital/acquired conditions).  The bill aims to improve health outcomes for premature and vulnerable infants, with implementation primarily beginning January 1, 2026.
